title: question
body: should a player be banned if he/she intentionally bans a champion that im hovering?

replies.body: No.
can you explain why?

> [{quoted}](name=Invidie,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=yRftdxbc,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-23T21:09:58.671+0000)
>
> can you explain why?

Because there are upsides and downsides to each model.

Ultimately, however, if he bans your champ you have to play your *second* favorite champion in that role.

If we flip it and let people troll hover to give picks to the enemy team, he might be able to force you to play into your *least* favorite match-up.

As a result, Riot had to pick one of the two models: Pick > Ban, or Ban > Pick. Both have good and bad elements, and they simply opted for this one.

i was simply hovering miss fortune, but some one on my team intentionally banned it, that means he/she ruined my game, and according to riot, "his/her deliberate choice to ruin league for others reflects a gross breach of community-defined standards".
so shouldn't he/she get punished for ruining my game?

I think that action is not punishable. What would make it likely to be punishable, is if there were added chat toxicity involved: "I banned her because your winrate on her is 30%" or "Only bronzies play that champ."

let me add this, that person banned my champion because he/she said i have "14 games over 3 months". so now is his/her actions punishable?
edit: he also told me to go play normals for some reason. ( it was a ranked game btw, he intentionally banned the champion i was HOVERING just because i had 14games in this season.)

Riot has decided that players have the right to ban whatever they want. If you feel he did so malevolently you can report him, and the Tribunal might identify his behavior as toxic based on the chat.

The keyword here is "deliberate choice to ruin..." or "intent".  Did he do it to troll or he simply do not wish to play with or against MF.  Unless he bragged or admitted in chat, neither Rito nor you can prove his "intention".  He can easily claimed that he didn't do it to troll you, but simply using my ban choice to not have to play with MF on the team or to prevent enemy team from picking her, which is currently a very valid reason under Rito's system.
i dont know if hes trying to troll me or not, he said i have 14games in this season, and banned my champion that i was hovering, he ruined my game.

....and if you play MF, you ruined his game (just on the other end of the table).... He can ban a champ simply because he does not wish to play with against that champ.

The fact of the matter is that ban pick has priority over actual pick.  It is the system we have.  It is something you will have to learn to live with.  Next time, don't hover champs that are: 1) newly released 2) newly reworked 3) new skins that just came out.

he did his research btw , he looked up my opgg , i have a 75% win rate with mf.
btw i dont have the new skin.

Well I hope you reported him and let the IFS sort it out.

Each person get 1 ban choice.  IF he/she feels a champ that will be detriment to the team, he is free to ban it for whatever reason.  If someone is stupid enough to blatant typed he used it to troll, then suck to be him.  Personally, if he feels that MF will be a detriment to the team when played by you, that's his choice.  If he did it because he feels it will help the team win, that is or at least should not be punishable.  If he did it purely to troll, that is punishable.  You cannot determine his intention from what you said he said.

Just like you have your own choice of ban and no one is allowed to questioned you on it.

I get my "off-meta" most played champ banned all the time which I suspect has something to do with someone looking up my profile.  I don't cry about it.  If he doesn't want me to play my most comfortable champ, so be it.  I will play my less comfortable game to whatever outcome.
at least i didnt ban his champion.

Because you don't care if he plays that particular champ or not (or you don't believe 2 wrongs make a right I hope).  However, it is not mutually exclusive.  Just because you don't want to or didn't ban his champ doesn't mean he can't or shouldn't ban yours.
